resources.title: Godot Documentation - Delta Time and Frame Rate

codeExamples.title: Frame-Independent Movement with Delta Time
codeExamples.code:
extends Node2D

# Movement speed in pixels per second
@export var speed: float = 200.0
var velocity: Vector2 = Vector2.ZERO

func _ready():
    # Set initial movement direction
    velocity = Vector2(1, 0) * speed

func _process(delta: float):
    # Use delta to make movement frame-independent
    # Without delta: position would depend on framerate
    # With delta: consistent movement regardless of FPS
    position += velocity * delta
    
    # Bounce off screen edges
    var screen_size = get_viewport().get_visible_rect().size
    if position.x <= 0 or position.x >= screen_size.x:
        velocity.x *= -1
    if position.y <= 0 or position.y >= screen_size.y:
        velocity.y *= -1
codeExamples.explanation: This demonstrates the core game loop concept of delta time. The `_process(delta)` function is called every frame, and delta represents the time elapsed since the last frame. By multiplying movement by delta, we ensure consistent speed regardless of framerate - crucial for fair gameplay. Without delta, the object would move faster on high-FPS systems and slower on low-FPS systems.
